page.title: 03Barnby Dun Parish Church
page.content: The church of{St.Peter and St.Paul}is built close by the River Don.It was first mentioned in Domesday_"there was a priest and a church at Beorn".The parish is semi_rural with industry in the vicinity.The vicar is also responsible for the very small church at Kirk Bramwithtwo miles further down the River Don.The present church was built in the 14th.C.,the 64'high tower followed in the 15th.C.There is a fine {15th.C.font}and several examples of beautiful{stained glass windows}dating from the same early period.The church was fully restored in the 19th.C.(1859-62),the nave roof being rotten and the chancel unsafe.The nave roof was replaced with the present high pitched roof of Westmorland slate.This fine church is surrounded by a small graveyard which has an overspill at the rear.
